thesis.description: The signal to noise ratio of a radar system can be improved by increasing the Pulse Repetition Frequency, (PRF). When the maximum range of the radar, Rmax, is greater than 1/2 cT where: (1) c = velocity of light (2) T = interval between transmitted pulses the position of a target which is situated at a distance R from radar ( 3) 1/2 cT < R < cT will be indicated as (4) r = R - cT where (5) r = distance of target indicated by radar. Every transmitted pulse initiates a sweep. [...]
thesis.creator: Javid, Mansour.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: Performance Characteristics of a Base-Line-Scanning Ambiguity Filter for High PRF Radars.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Hydrogen, more than any other gaseous substance,has been investigated in electric discharges and a greatdeal of evidence has been accumulated for its existence inthe atomic state.
thesis.creator: Jamieson, James W.S.
thesis.subject: Physical Chemistry.
thesis.title: Reactions of Atomic Hydrogen with Ethylenimine, N-Methyl Ethylenimine and Ethylamine.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Geomorphology, from its Greek derivation, is the study of the shape of the earth's surface and, as such, it falls within the realms of both geography and geology. In each of the two disciplines, however, its objectives differ. The core of geographical research is the study of the 'region' and geomorphology provides this with a physical basis. [...]
thesis.creator: Ives, John David.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: Oraefi, South-East Iceland: an Essay in Regional Geomorphology.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: By bombarding a gold target at a proton energy of 61 Mev the isotopes Pt192 and Pt191 were indirectly produced. Photographs were taken with the help of a 180° focussing spectrograph. Of the 207 lines examined, 170 were identified. Those assigned to Pt192, and Pt191 are given in separate tables.
thesis.creator: Huq, M.S.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Radiation from Pt192 and Proposed Decay Scheme.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis describes the manner in which a beam of 25 x 10^6 protons/second at 90 Mev was extracted from the McGill synchrocyclotron and taken to a well-shielded position. A 1.46 gms/cm^2 uranium foil scattered the main cyclotron beam 5.5° into a magnet channel which was placed 3-4° in azimuth from the target and aligned by the current-carrying stretched wire technique. The channel is interrupted to insert iron wedges on the moveable internal probe and thus to adjust for suitable focus of the beam in the vertical plane.
thesis.creator: Hunt, John. W.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Studies of the external beam of the McGill synchro-cyclotron.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The codling moth, Carpocapsa pomonella (L.) a persistent pest in apple orchards throughout the North-American continent, has been a source of concern tor over a century. For many years lead arsenate was used to control but gradually became less effective as the insect developed resistance (Hough, 1929). DDT, after its introduction in 1945, gave excellent control and is now the most widely used insecticide against the pest. Its use, however, has not been without some disadvantages, chief of which are an upsurge of phytophagus mites, and to a less extent other pests such as the red-banded leafroller, due in large part to the destruction of natural enemies.
thesis.creator: Hikichi, Akira.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: The effect of DDT on codling moth adults (Carpocapsa pomonella L.) (Lepidoptera: Olethreutidae).
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Our aim is to establish and discuss a certain class of conditions on the functions fi which ensure that the system (E) has a unique solution through a given point of D. We conclude with a survey of the principal results in this field which were encountered in a study of the literature. Since these results are extremely scattered, the last resumé being that of Müller (7), it is felt that this is also of some value.
thesis.creator: Herschorn, Michael.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: Uniqueness theorems for ordinary differential equations.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Studies on problems of early maturity in plants have engaged the active interest of geneticists and plant breeders for many years. The value of such studies has been emphasized by the importance of developing varieties or strains of plants early enough in maturity to satisfy certain practical demands. Corn varieties or hybrids adapted to regions of low heat unit accumulation such as areas in the humid, microthermal climate north of the Corn Belt, must be extremely early in maturity.
thesis.creator: Henry, Vann. C.
thesis.subject: Agronomy.
thesis.title: A study of the inheritance of earliness in Gaspé flint and some inbred lines of corn.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The energy spectra of neutrons emitted from nuclei of several elements bombarded by protons of energies in the region of 25 and 40 Mev have been examined using nuclear emulsion techniques. The energy distributions can be fitted fairly well by Maxwellian shapes at low energies, though the apparent nuclear temperatures calculated from the spectra of neutrons emitted in the forward direction are higher for most elements than those derived from neutron spectra emitted at 180° to the incident proton beam. At high energies the distributions fall off more slowly than the low energy Maxwellian shapes would predict.
thesis.creator: Heckman, Donald. E.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Neutron energy distributions from proton induced reactions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Attention was immediately turned to making greater use of barley as a livestock feed within Canada with the closure of the market for its sale to Denmark on the declaration of the Second World War. To-day from a livestock feeding standpoint barley is to the Canadian farmer what corn is to his counterpart in the United States. The importance of barley as a livestock feed was recognized by the National Barley Feed Committee when it decided in 1936 to assemble all the information then available on the botanical, chemical and nutritive qualities of this grain with a view to the preparation of tables of feed composition.
thesis.creator: Haskell, Stanley. R.
thesis.subject: Health Sciences, Nutrition
thesis.title: A study of the nutritive value of western Canadian barley.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The widespread use of mass roentgenographic surveys in the past decade has led to an increase in the proportion of individuals having few or doubtful clinical signs and symptoms of tuberculosis. It is difficult and often impossible to demonstrate the presence of the tubercle bacillus in the excreta of such individuals by the use of cultural methods in common laboratory use. Since recovery of the tubercle bacillus admits of no further uncertainty in the diagnosis, its detection in doubtful cases has an importance which can scarcely be overestimated.
thesis.creator: Hannan, Charles. K.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: The cultivation of M. tuberculosis recovered by oil partition.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: An attempt is made to measure the loss tangent of dry air (a non-polar gas) using a resonance-curve method in a spherical Cavity at 1350 mc. The apparatus used is described and is show to possess a high order of frequency and amplitude stability. Although a large number of measurements are made in order to try to obtain a statistical average, the results are indeterminate. The conclusion is reached that the quantity being measured is too small for the apparatus to resolve.
thesis.creator: Haberl, John F.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: Microwave measurements on high-Q cavities.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Quand Hubert Gignoux entreprit d'écrire un livre sur l'œuvre de Jean Anouilh, il pria celui-ci de lui donner des renseignements biographiques sur lui-même. Voilà la réponse d'Anouilh : "Je n'ai pas de biographie, et j'en suis très content. Je suis né le 23 juin 1910 à Bordeaux, je suis venu jeune à Paris, j'ai été à l'école primaire supérieure Colbert, au collège Chaptal. Un an et demi à la Faculté de Droit de Paris, deux ans dans une maison de publicité, où j'ai pris des leçons de précision et d'ingéniosité qui m'ont tenu lieu d'études poétiques.
thesis.creator: Gyorgy, Anne. M.
thesis.subject: French.
thesis.title: Les héroines d’Anouilh.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The dicholine ester of succinic acid (succinyldicholine; SDC) is a potent muscle-relaxant widely used in modern anaesthetic practice. The special properties of this drug are best considered in relation to those of other muscle relaxants. The clinical use of muscle relaxants in general and SDC in particular will therefore be reviewed. The paralytic properties of curare were well known to the South American Indiana who used it as a crude plant-extract painted on arrowheads.
thesis.creator: Greenway, Robert. M.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: The metabolism of choline esters of succinic acid.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The comparatively rare positive electron or positron appears to have exactly the same mass as the negative electron. In a vacuum it is stable, but in the presence of matter in any form, it readily combines with an ordinary negative electron, and the result is the complete disappearance of the mass of the pair and the emission of gamma rays of equivalent energy. This process is called annihilation and the radiation emitted is annihilation radiation. The emission of one photon is theoretically possible but can occur only in the presence of a very strong external field or very near a nucleus. Otherwise the total momentum for the process could not be conserved.
thesis.creator: Green, Ralph. E.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Quenching of triplet positronium by ions in aqueous solutions.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The physical properties of cellulose nitrate {commonly known as nitrocellulose) and of the parent compound, cellulose, have been under investigation for nearly a century. Basic to their physical properties is the movement of the component molecules. Movement in polar molecules can be detected by perturbing the molecules with an electric field and by observing the electrical reaction as the molecules revert to a condition indistinguishable from their initial one. The latter process is known as dielectric relaxation.
thesis.creator: Gordon, Ralph. W.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Dielectric relaxation of cellulose nitrate and cellulose.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Hypothermia is proving its value in surgery through its ability to reduce the basal metabolism and oxygen requirements of the body tissues. This enables the tissues to withstand prolonged periods of total or partial ischemia without injury. The vascular supply to organs may thus be occluded, allowing the surgeon to work in a comparatively bloodless field with little danger of tissue damage due to anoxia.
thesis.creator: Goodall, Robert. G.
thesis.subject: Experimental Surgery.
thesis.title: An evaluation of hypothermia in hepatic and major abdominal surgery in dogs.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A photoconductive diode can be constructed from a bar of semi-conducting material containing a region of p type conductivity and one of n type conductivity. However, a more sensitive device is realized if three regions are used alternately n,p,n. The npn structure, a phototransistor, provides a current approximately fifty times greater than that obtained from a pn photodiode illuminated by the same light source. Several of these npn units were constructed and the performance of each as a two-terminal phototransistor was evaluated.
thesis.creator: Goldie, Hugh. J.
thesis.subject: Electrical Engineering.
thesis.title: A study of phototransistors.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: During the summer of 1955 the author was employed by Bellechasse Mining Corporation to make a geological map of a group of 77 claims and to supervise a Packsack drill programme on mineralized showings at Pegma Lake. Aeromagnetic anomalies were checked and geological mapping of these anomalies was carried out in the area surrounding Pegma Lake. This thesis is concerned with the general geology and petrology of the rocks in the claim group. A mineralographical study is made of the metallic minerals in mineralized rocks of the area.
thesis.creator: Gleeson, Christopher. F.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: The geology and mineralization of the Pegma Lake area in New Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This phase of the investigation was concerned with a study of the urinary excretion of estriol, estrone and estradiol -17B following the intramuscular injection of estradiol -17B in men with myocardial infarction. The results were compared with those of a control group of male subjects with no clinical evidence of this disease. The study was undertaken for the reasons set forth below. Myocardial infarction is rare in women before the menopause but postmenopausal women show a high incidence of this disease.
thesis.creator: Givner, Morris. L.
thesis.subject: Biochemistry.
thesis.title: Estrogen metabolism in human subjects.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The areas under consideration in this thesis were geologically surveyed in the summer of 1954 by the Newfoundland and Labrador Corporation. Reconnaissance work was carried out by four field parties that were "spotted" at various locations during the summer, and by a helicopter party. One of the field groups was headed by the writer. The interval between traverses was from one-half to one mile. A study was made of thin sections cut from specimens collected by these parties and a description of these sections is the chief contribution of this thesis.
thesis.creator: Gillett, Laurie. B.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Anorthosites and syenites of the Mealy Mountain area, Labrador.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Between January 1952 and May 1953 the United States Naval Medical Research Unit No. 3, stationed at Cairo, Egypt, undertook an extensive survey of the local fauna for the presence of schistosomes. As a result, a large number of helminths, other than schistosomes, was collected and some were forwarded to the Institute of Parasitology at Macdonald College for identification. This thesis deals with the classification of those nematodes collected from Carnivora. It is hoped that eventually a complete host list for all the parasites obtained in the area will be published.
thesis.creator: Gibbs, Harold. C.
thesis.subject: Parasitology.
thesis.title: Some nematode parasites from Egyptian carnivora.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Crickets belong to the family Gryllidae (Orthoptera) and are common in houses, fields, pasture, meadows, and some inhabit trees and shrubs. Most of them feed on plants and grains but some occasionally feed on other insects. Several species of crickets overwinter as eggs, laid generally in the moist ground or vegetation, while others in tropical climates pass the winter either as nymphs of late instars, or as adults. They are among the most familiar insects. In Italy and North Africa crickets, which are best known for the musical sounds made by the male, are kept in cages tor the sake of their notes.
thesis.creator: Ghouri, Ahmad. S.
thesis.subject: Entomology.
thesis.title: The effect of temperature and nutrition on the development of the house cricket, Acheta domesticus (L.) (Gryllidae, Orthoptera), and two related species of crickets.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The objective of this work was to prepare nitramines of 2-amino- 6-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 4-amino-2-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 4-amino- 3-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 2-amino-4-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 2-amino- 5-cyano-4, 6-dimethylpyridine and their rearranged products. The compounds: 2-amino-4-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 2-amino-6-pyridinecarboxylic acid, 4-amino-2-pyridinecarboxylic acid and 4-amino-3-pyridinecarboxylic acid have been prepared by permanganate oxidation of the corresponding acetamidopicolines. Further, 2-amino-4-pyridinecarboxylic acid bas been also obtained by the reduction of 2-nitro-4-pyridinecarboxylic acid with iron powder and 20% acetic acid.
thesis.creator: Gantchev, Neno.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Nitramines of the pyridinecarboxylic acids series.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The object of the theory of Group Representation is the study of all homomorphisms of a given group into irreducible groups of matrices of finite degree with coefficients in an assigned field. An important case is that in which the prescribed field is the field of complex numbers. The theory was originated by Frobenius. His most important results were again found independently by Burnside who gave a number of important applications of the theory as well as its classical treatment.
thesis.creator: French, Betty. R.
thesis.subject: Mathematics.
thesis.title: The representations of particular groups.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
